links.*: The Book of Lost Tales Part Two

wikitext.*:
==Quenya==
'''''foa''''' is a [[Quenya]] word, which in a ca. [[1968]] text is said to mean "breath, puff of breath", deriving from the [[Wikipedia:Onomatopoeia|onomatopoetic]] [[Common Eldarin]] word ''phā''.<ref>{{VT|47a}}, pp. 35, 36</ref> 

In a ca. [[1959]] text, [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] noted the [[Sundocarme|root]] PHAW-, said to signify "emit (foul breath etc.)" and to have yielded the derivatives "''phawalōkō'' > ''[[foalókë]]''".<ref>{{PE|17}}, p. 181</ref>

==Qenya==
'''''foa''''' is a [[Qenya]] word meaning "hoard, treasure". It is found in the compound ''[[foalókë#Other versions of the legendarium|foalókë]]'' (''foa'' + ''[[lókë]]'').<ref>{{LT2|Appendix}}, p. 340</ref><ref>{{PE|12}}</ref>
